Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) are high-temperature, high-efficiency, combustionless electrochemical energy conversion devices that have potential for combined cycle applications.
Titulo: Efficiency Evaluation of Solid-Oxide Fuel Cells in Combined Cycle Operations

Sentencas: This paper intends to clarify and expand the efficiency discussions related to SOFC when operating in combined cycle (CC) systems.
Titulo: Efficiency Evaluation of Solid-Oxide Fuel Cells in Combined Cycle Operations

Sentencas: A brief analysis of the first and second thermodynamic laws is conducted and, building upon a previously developed SOFC dynamic model, operating fuel heating values are determined by utilizing the semi-empirical gas phase heat capacity method.
Titulo: Efficiency Evaluation of Solid-Oxide Fuel Cells in Combined Cycle Operations

Sentencas: As a result, accurate SOFC stack operational simulations are conducted to calculate its efficiency based on actual thermodynamic parameters.
Titulo: Efficiency Evaluation of Solid-Oxide Fuel Cells in Combined Cycle Operations

Sentencas: Furthermore, an analysis is conducted of a combined SOFC-CC system using dynamic modeling.
Titulo: Efficiency Evaluation of Solid-Oxide Fuel Cells in Combined Cycle Operations

Sentencas: Simulation results are given, which are intended to aid researchers in evaluating hybrid SOFC-CC generation systems.
Titulo: Efficiency Evaluation of Solid-Oxide Fuel Cells in Combined Cycle Operations
